question: Question_A_16
statement:
Write the matrix $A$ so that the equation

\[s \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \end{array} \right] + t \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ -1 \end{array} \right] = \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 10 \end{array} \right]\]
can be represented as a matrix equation,

: A\textbackslash{}left{[}\textbackslash{}begin\{array\}\{c\} s
\textbackslash{}\textbackslash{} t \textbackslash{}end\{array\}
\textbackslash{}right{]} =
\textbackslash{}left{[}\textbackslash{}begin\{array\}\{c\} -2
\textbackslash{}\textbackslash{} 10 \textbackslash{}end\{array\}
\textbackslash{}right{]}.
hints:
Set

\[A = \left[\begin{array}{cc}
a & b \\ c & d
\end{array}\right]\] and calculate

\[\left[\begin{array}{cc}
a & b \\ c & d
\end{array}\right] \left[\begin{array}{c} s\\t \end{array}\right]\]
Matching one-by-one will give you the values of \emph{a}, \emph{b},
\emph{c} and \emph{d}.
